intro: Symplocos mamberamo, commonly known as the Mamberamo symplocos, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes plants adapted to nutrient-poor soils. The plant features elliptical, glossy leaves that are often clustered at the ends of branches. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. The fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
